ygData.subject: Re: Infected Paw
ygData.msgSnippet: This sounds good!  I just need to organize a proper party and move in. Thanks for that positive view!  A group of 6 33-40 would be fine there I take it.  At
ygData.messageBody:
This sounds good! I just need to organize a proper party and move in.
Thanks for that positive view! A group of 6 33-40 would be fine there I
take it. At least if there is already another group running rampant! Looks
like I will be headed back.

Fflewduer Fflamson
P.S. I realize that i saw a very very small part of Paw my first trip which
is why I qualified it by saying up to the double doors. We did in fact go a
bit beyond that, but were trained back out and decided to play it safe and
learn a bit more before pushing in too far. On the other hand...fighting in
and seeing what is there has a lot of appeal!



> >are empty, and definately something that would be very difficult for a
> >pickup group.
>
>I had some very interesting experiences in Paw this week, and can safely
>say
>it is a very exciting place and provided me with hours of
>adrenaline-pulsing
>thrills.
>
>I never visited the old Paw, back when those wimpy Splitpaw gnolls were
>around, so when I entered a few days ago for the first time I was quite
>apprehensive. I was accompanied by some guildmates, including a 50th level
>druid and a 47th level ranger, with whom I have been in far worse places
>(in
>fact, we had just come from Lower Guk).
>
>When we entered we ran into a group of old friends (well, I knew only a few
>of them, but my groupmates knew them all). The 9 of us (I think the
>youngest was 32 or so) headed in as one band, and cleared the way as we
>went. Each group had an evacer (druid for us, wiz for the others) and a
>bard to keep everyone functioning to their fullest capacity. Well, long
>story short, we got to the home of the Ishva (mommy gnoll, around 40th
>level), and in a HUGE battle that lasted 8 minutes, we almost killed her,
>she healed herself fully (grrrrr), and we got her back down to 1/16th life
>before every one of us died (I was second to last to fall, the other bard
>was last). We were so close nobody wanted to evac... though we all died,
>we
>had a blast, and we've vowed to get our revenge on that <ahem> bitch
>(pardon
>the zoological term).
>
>The nonunique gnolls down there go at least as high as 35th level, from
>what
>I have seen, and there are 2 unique gnolls I have found so far: Ishva and
>the named gnoll "Boss" after whom one of the tribes is named. His name
>escapes me, but we were disappointed to find he had no loot at all. Ishva
>is FAR tougher, be warned.
>
>Try it out - the new Paw is a very exciting place to hunt, and almost every
>puppy drops a few plat and FS, so the money and experience are good. It is
>also very underhunted as of yet, and from what I have seen every gnoll
>there
>has a chance of dropping nice stuff (Splitpaw aromr, weapons, misc magic
>items, etc). Very very few gnolls see invisible, and we made several
>corpse
>recoveries with no trouble, so if you have someone to evac you can slip
>past
>the entryway and head right down to the big fights.
>
>Aloro Silvertongue (E'ci)
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
>with the subject submissions.
